channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Redundant "road markings" should be removed in Randall Place, 8th January
item.description:
The "old" section of ZigZag markings are redundant and should be removed. This section of Randall Place is now allocated-parking for Residents and Business use. The "white" parking-demarcation lines also need to be re-painted. Refer to photos. NOTE: An opportunity was missed to do this work earlier in this week (06.01.26). Highway Maintenance were in attendance removing, and painting new "road markings" at the end of Roan Street (junction with Greenwich High Street)

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Randall Place, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees along Albion Channel (nr Mousetail Coffee) have sunk, 8th January
item.description:
Trees along the south east of Albion Channel, near Mousetail Coffee, between Canada Water and Surrey Quays Road appear to have sunk down in recent weeks. Can the council (or infrastructure owner) raise them to the correct height (level with footpath) to avoid an unnecessary trip hazard/accident please?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Deal Porter Square, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Railings outside no 26/28 leaning into road make parking difficult., 8th January
item.description:
Railing was erected to protect a tree or its roots. The tree was removed some time ago. Now therefore no need for railings. Can they be removed please? They are right on the edge of pavement leaning into the road making parking there difficult. Thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Derwent Grove, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Residents parking bays, 8th January
item.description:
The lines indicating the residents parking bays are virtually non-existent in Bkackthorn Grove DA7 4EH. This results in incorrect parking. Residents wanting to park are unable to do so because vehicles are parked incorrectly in the bays

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackthorn Grove, Welling, Greater London

item.title: Crystal Palace Parade, SE19 1UA at the end, 8th January
item.description:
Crystal Palace Parade, SE19 1UA at the end of number 10 – 11 (Cafe Paradou) (yes this is on the Lambeth side of the boundary with Southwark) at right hand end of frontage on white painted concrete rendered wall under advert wall tagged. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for reporting pin, & Google Streetview link: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.4206056,-0.0783686,3a,22.1y,262.54h,85.06t/data=!3m8!1e1!3m6!1sj2IWrIjITuUM_8T5kVfPxg!2e0!5s20250501T000000!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D4.938397375944518%26panoid%3Dj2IWrIjITuUM_8T5kVfPxg%26yaw%3D262.53642875602077!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI2MDEwNC4wIKXMDSoKLDEwMDc5MjA2N0gBUAM%3D
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Crystal Palace Parade, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load

item.title: The pavement and pedestrian road are full of water due to heavy rain., 8th January
item.description:
The manhole in this area appears to be blocked, preventing water from draining properly. As a result, the entire area is flooded, and pedestrians are unable to use the walkway safely. This situation poses a serious inconvenience and potential safety risk to the public. I kindly request that this issue be inspected and resolved as soon as possible. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12-16, York Way, Islington, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked gulley causing flooding and risk to my property and the public, 8th January
item.description:
Previously reported in December but was informed no action to be taken, which was very surprising considering the issue has been reported in the past and unblocked by the Highways team. This needs to be cleaned as Rats will start to materialise, based on previous experiences.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Edison Grove, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fuel Spill, 8th January
item.description:
Outside the BT telephone exchange there is a big fuel spill. It is on the road and also along the pavement. It runs for at least 10m. It looks like someone has tried to clear some of it up with red grit but there is still a lot of excess that hasn't been treated. I think it happened yesterday as I could smell it (from around 100m away) but today I saw how bad it was when I walked that way.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grove Park Road, Mottingham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
